Reviews.Title: “Great location but needs repairs”
Reviews.Author: ONail2010
Reviews.Content: On the plus side: Great location in city center in safe, well-policed area. All main attractions in Madrid center at walking distance, plus access to subway station right outside hotel. Fair-sized rooms. Beds, ok. On the minus side: Traffic noise at all times (hotel is on very busy street) - old, ill-fitting windows don't provide adequate insulation, therefore earplugs strongly recommended. Prehistoric, fixed shower-head in otherwise satisfactory bathroom. Conclusion: Convenient location, reasonably priced, needs renovation work.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE IF YOU WANT AIR CONDITIONING BETWEEN 3:00 AM AND NOON don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: greekgirl9245
Reviews.Content: Older hotel in downtown Madrid. Good size rooms ( a paint job would be a blessing ); mattresses need to be replaced. Friendly staff. For those looking for a cheap thrill go no further - hooker row just around the corner. Metro, Starbucks, and Mcdonalds a few steps away. The thing that really annoyed us is that the hotel has a policy of shutting off the air conditioning after 3:00 am. The fan works but the AIR CONDITIONING is OFF. Nowhere is this hotel policy disclosed. I don't know about you but to me a perfectly running air conditioning unit is a must at a hotel i choose to stay in. Complained but was told it was hotel policy. Who can argue with that except that if this is the case the hotel should also make it their policy to advise all potentiall patrons of it, in advance, and not after they have taken our money... Buyer Beware.

Reviews.Title: “Poor room and service”
Reviews.Author: Kanuckian
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ended up here because and airline which will remain unnamed forgot to put our luggage on the plane. We were forced to spend our first night in Madrid on a trip to Portugal to visit friends. I had a night booked on the way home at the Hotel Preciados....so we tried there first...no luck, all booked. The receptionist was gracious enought to help find another room...and we ended up at the Tryp. A little bit snobby reception, followed by a brutal room - cold, no rugs, bed on wheels, very uncomfortable ....led to a shaky start to our summer European trip. At least it was a bed right? Well, I wasn't impressed and I don't , know having stayed at the Preciados, consider it comfortable at all! Sorry Tryp, but your quality isn't up to your neighbors standards.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: atabh
Reviews.Content: Location: Perfect. Right on top of Gran Via metro station and a couple of minutes walk to Sol station and about 10 minutes + to Plaza Mayor. Everything i within easy reach and one could not ask for a better location. You can catch a metro to/from the airport for Euro 5 and it takes about 40 minutes. However you do need to change 2 lines. Wi fi: Free in room and good strength. Reception: Helpful and friendly staff. Well versed in English. Lobby is nicely done up. The doors are closed at night and you have to buzz yourself in which is a great safety feature. Rooms: Basic. A bit jaded and could do with some upgrades. Beds are ok and bathroom is of a good size. Overall a good hotel but can become a great hotel if they invest a bit in upgrading the carpets/decor/beds etc .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, safe area”
Reviews.Author: Megachaoren
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, great location. We took metro from airport and got to grand via station which is right in front of hotel. Easy access to all tourist sites and rental car company avis is nearby. The room is tiny but clean. However it could be noisy at night since its in the city center facing a really busy street. Mcdonlads right next door and Starbucks across the street. You probably don't need that. But I think it indicates the location of hotel and surrounding. National palace and Prado are both 15 min away,in opposite directions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: EuroTravellerLDN
Reviews.Content: Great for Chueca and puerto del sol. Lots of cafes and shops nearby. Right outside gran via metro station..i chose this purely for location. Room pretty small but clean and fine !

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Chonner
Reviews.Content: The location was great but the reception was pretty slow. It is right off the main road Gran Via and very accessible by metro from the airport with only 1 transfer and 2.50 Euros.The trains were excellent, very clean and mostly air conditioned so the ride was easy if you are looking for a way to get to the city centre. The plus side was free WiFi in the room with excellent reception. The breakfast buffet was actually much better than I expected with a good variety (for European standards). It offered both cold and hot dishes and I thought it was pretty nice. The hotel is located on 10-15 mins away from the Royal Palace by walking and less than 5 mins from Sol. If you're just looking for a central place to crash, this is a pretty decent spot. The room itself was decent, I'm just glad I brought my own sandals because the carpeting was pretty suspect but overall, not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marjucca100
Reviews.Content: The only good thing of this hotel is location! location ! The breakfast was lousy. Who heard of boiled bacon and served cold !!no warmers or at least they did not work. The food served the previous night you find it on the breakfast table next morning. The room was so small all our thing were scattered all over the place floor suitcase on the headboard.It was so chaotic one could not swing a cat. The bathroom was bigger than our room!. Carpet was thread bare.One good thing though it was cleaned every day and the bed linen was changed regularly.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Stay”
Reviews.Author: helloactive
Reviews.Content: An expensive hotel for what you got. I would rate it a one star. The carpet was old, soiled and wrinkled. The air conditioner worked occassionally. The hair dryer quit and the replacement not much better. Had to move rooms as the one they said was none smoking was not!. Recommend not staying here at all. Location great but many others in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid, Spain”
Reviews.Author: RetiredNavy80
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent - right in the middle of town on a main thoroughfare. Rooms are extremely small and sparse for American standards. Very noisy both day and night. Could not regulate the heat and complained but to no avail. Heat only came on for two hours and then turned off. If you don't set your standard too high, the location makes up for any room inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “A terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Wishanotherworld
Reviews.Content: I was there for a conference in November. The second day I came down with a terrible flu, with a high fever. It was cold and the heating system did not work. I was feeling miserable and asked for help. They told me the heating system is central and they could not turn it on for me - it would be turned on at 7pm. Nobody took care of me, nobody proposed to call a doctor, and I had to wait for 3 hours before they brought me two additional blankets. Nobody even offer me a cup of hot tea or soup (and there is a kitchen in the hotel!). Had to go out to get something hot to drink. Fortunately I was able to jump on a plane two day after and go back home. Definitely NOT recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great breakfast, somewhat noisy”
Reviews.Author: fsdukejr
Reviews.Content: Old hotel but in outstanding location. Creative and extensive breakfast buffet, one of the best we have experienced. Lifts are very old and small but work most of the time. Door to the room is like a vault with safe-like metal bars in the frame. Comfortable beds. If you leave the window open, the street noise can get loud about 3AM. Central location allows you to walk almost anywhere. Very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to see Madrid”
Reviews.Author: MartyVV
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my parents and 2 aunts who are seniors. It provide a convinient location from which to explore downtown Madrid. It is close to the Plaza Mayor and Peuta de Sol. The shopping on the surounding blocks is great. The staff were helpful. They organized a refridgerator for my fathers medication, and helped all of us hook up to free WiFi. At the end of the stay they arranged a cab to the airport. The hall carpets are threadbare but the rooms are very clean. The staff did a great job cleaning and restocking the rooms each day. At night it was very noisy. The Grand Via is a super busy street and you can hear the noise in the hotel. The hotel had school groups staying and they were noisy in the hallways and stairs till late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: gary51
Reviews.Content: The Tryp Washington is a 3 star Hotel and just about earns the title. We stayed in a room facing a courtyard, and all these Courtyard rooms are rather small. The room decor is fine its just the size. Breakast was OK, but one feature let it down and that was it seems to attract lots of student groups, and they hang around the very small reception area. Every day we had difficulty getting into and out of the Hotel due to these students. The Hotel is joined to the Tryp Memphis behind the Hotels Front entrance, and this Hotels looks a lot better. Location is fine, right on the "Gran Via". TGI Fridays is less than 50 Metres away, and these are good Spanish restaurants either side of the Hotel. What suprised us was the cheapness of the Restaurants, having been to Barcelona we found Madrid prices a lot cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: tomtdn
Reviews.Content: Prime location on the edge of Old Town...within steps of metro line...five minutes walking away from Sol..a few more to Plaza Mayor. The staff was helpful and accomodating.Because Grand Via is a major street and my room was on street side...you could hear activity throughout the night. Madrid never sleeps! But I've stayed on a pedestrian street in Old Town and it wasn't really any different. Police patrol the area constantly, just like they do in Sol. A neighboring street has prostitutes at night with police on either end and families walking up and down the street..so a bit of colorful atmosphere...which can be avoided if necessary...but isn't a threat or a problem. Across from the hotel and up and down on either side of Grand via are lots of good shopping venues...and restaurants within a minute or two in all directions. This is not a 4 star hotel, but a very good 3 star with good prices, lots to do within walking distance and a great location if you plan to use public transportation.I ranked it higher than probably most...becasue for the type of trip I had planned it was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: theduende
Reviews.Content: location perfect in the centre of Madrid, excellent for sight seeing, theatre and cinema enthusiasts. Check in was a little slow as was check out. On leaving the elevator on my allocated floor I was shocked by the state of the carpet in the common areas, threadbare somewhat dirty. I was however relieved when entering my room and seeing the much improved carpet. Rooms were nicely decorated however in most other hotels of 3 star the individual rooms tend to have larger beds rather a simple single bed. I did not take advantage of the breakfast offered and the room servise consisted of a menu for the local Telepizza. There vending machines available for coffee, soft drinks, crisps and sweets in the first floor lounge. In conclusion for the price I payed through Hotels.com I was happily satisfied however, their advertised, walk in price, is somewhat expensive for the standard.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have been in ever.The rooms are worn out. The beds are old. The carpets in the room show the foundation. I d”
Reviews.Author: Blackman11
Reviews.Content: Very central location but only ok if you can not afford any better hotel. The hotel is run down and not ok to any standard above one star. The staff is friendly and there are new flat creen TVs in the room but the whole buildind is not up to european hotel standards. When riding an elevator you fear for your live.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: DanielleONeillTravel
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel with everything you need. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The location was fantastic, the Metro is right out the front, you could walk everywhere. Only 30 minutes on the Metro to the Airport, only cost 1 Euro. For a hotel where you just wanted to sleep and spend the rest of your time sight seeing, this is the one!

Reviews.Title: “Good price, very clean, perfect and safe location”
Reviews.Author: sur149
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect, full of restaurants, close to main touristic attractions and the underground. It is also a very safe area. I was traveling alone and safety is extremely important to me. I paid about 55 Euros per night (very cheap for a hotel in this area). My room was cleaned every day and the bathroom was very elegant. If you like shopping for a good price (in Serrano you will only find Boutiques) Gran Vía is perfect: El Corte Inglés, El Corte Inglés outlet (oportunidades), H & M, Zara, etc. Although you have a beautiful McDonalds right outside the hotel (very elegant compared with the ones in the US), try Rodilla. They have great food (much healthier) for a better price. Service was great, although the elevator and some furniture were dated. This is a great hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with great location!”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotter0089
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great with great location! The Metro Station of Gran Via was like 10 steps away and so was the nearest Mc Donalds. The city hop and off bus had a stop about 2 mins from the hotel. The shopping area was also right infront of the Hotel. The night we arrived we found out the location which was so great! Fortunately Transformers (the movie) was released that night in Madrid and premiere was 5-7 walk from there and we were able to see the trollers and the car outside the cinema! We stayed at the hotel two nights, it had really great breakfast! At night it was a bit noisy due to ambulance and police cars crossing the main road but it wasnt unbareable! All in all great experince and if we get a chance to travel to Madrid again, Hotel Tryp Gran Via will be our first choice!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: RoniB_TX
Reviews.Content: I was not expecting much but I was pleasantly surprised. The bathroom and amenities felt like a 5 star hotel. The rooms were big and very clean. The airconditioner was not working very well though. The staff spoke good English which was helpful because my Spanish is lacking . More importantly, they were very helpful and efficient. The location is perfect. It is walking distance to shopping centers, good restaurants, Plaza Mayor and the metro is a few steps away. Breakfast is not included but they had a good buffet for only 8 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Needs refurbishment, good location, reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: BlimeyNeedSleep
Reviews.Content: Double room booked, but hotel only had twin rooms left when we checked-in. Spent over 30min on phone to hotels.com (whilst roaming) trying to find out why this had happened. Hotel guy said they had no more doubles but could move us on the second night. First (twin) room was spacious and clean, but the carpets and general decor are starting to fall to bits. The room overlooked the main street but double glaxing meant noise wasn't a a problem. Second room (double) was a double but smaller and the carpet was down to its threads in places. A/C was broken (or non-existent as it turned out) so the room was quite hot. Other than that, beds were ok, plenty of blankets if needed, bathrooms clean. Shame, as overall as the hotel is in a great spot in Madrid to see all the sites within walking distance, but as I've discovered, hotels in cities like this tend to oversell their credentials and disappoint when you get there.

Reviews.Title: “I've stay at fleas motels that gave better value that this place!”
Reviews.Author: Buttercup_il
Reviews.Content: I've chosen this hotel because the travel agent described it as "good value at a great location". Well the location is indeed good, if you don't mind that right under the hotel there is a smallish street where working girls hang on every lamp post. Didn't concern me that much but could be offensive to others. My two main issues with this hotel are: 1. How noisy it is. They just didn't bother with any noise-isolation of any kind on the windows, and as it is the middle of the city you can hear ambulances, cars and even people singing on the street below all night long. 2. The service is exceptionally poor! The heating stopped working on 2 of the 4 nights we were there. They argued that we are wrong and it is working (!!) and when proven wrong tried to fix it but it just kept starting and stopping. Very annoying. Same goes for the elevators. They stopped working a couple of times including the last day of our stay when we had to haul our suitcases down 4 flights of stairs manually. There were some more small details I won't tire you with, but all in all i would expect much more from a hotel charging this much for a stay.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel very weak, but with a great location”
Reviews.Author: pauloCalmeida
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small and old. The beds are dire. Employees on night shift, they can not speak English. I stayed in a room that could not open the windows. Good location

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently Located, Reasonably Priced and Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: TianaV
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for €45 a night so I can't really complain about anything. When we got to our room it smelt like stale cigarettes but it was 10pm so I couldn't be bothered to change rooms. It was the middle of a sweltering summer and we had NO AIR-CON, we had to open the windows to let come air in but we're on the busiest street in Madrid so we got no sleep, but the nightlife is good so I didn't mind. Also, our room was directly inline with the giant fluoro screen of the Telefonica building, that thing is lit up all night. I recommend this hotel for younger people who will be taking advantage of the nightlife and don't really care about sleep OR ask for a room that doesn't face the street. We both had the breakfast on the first morning and it was so revolting we were both running to the toilet afterwards... Do not recommend it!! ALSO- If you're walking from the hotel to Puerta Del Sol at night beware of all the hookers!

Reviews.Title: “rude receptionists”
Reviews.Author: milehibabe
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located in an excellent place, thats the only thing it has going for it. The receptionists were rude and not helpful. The breakfast buffet was mediocore. You could hear everything on either side of the room. One other strength of this hotel is when you put up your "do not disturb" sign on the door they obey! Otherwise, this hotel is ok. The room overall was kinda small and we had seperate single beds which were very uncomfortable. Last but not least, if you dont have access to a laptop or overseas internet access by cell phone, the charge to you use their (very slow) computers is outrageous!! (i.e. 3 euros for 30 minutes) Better to go to one of those places called Locuteria for much cheaper internet rates!

Reviews.Title: “my stay at the Tryp, Gran Via,”
Reviews.Author: HildaH1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights,at our arrival to Spain and one additional night before leaving Europe during our 19 days tour in Europe.. I can say that even though the hotel is kind of old.. the rooms are kept clean, the surrondings of the hotel are clean and well kept, the hotel staff are friendly and ready to help at all times. The hotel has a great restaurant open until 11:30am with a great variety of breakfast items. The Hotel is located right in the middle of Gran Via, and it is withing walking distance to many of the interest points in Madrid. Overall, our stay at the hotel was pleasant, I do have to say that the A/c is turned off in the middle of the night, but overall it is a good hotel, and I would defenitely come back to stay with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Great money worth hotel”
Reviews.Author: UsKUsK
Reviews.Content: First time in Madrid, couldn't ask for better hotel, not expensive, very clean. Very central -- right next to "Gran Via" metro station. Even the breakfast was great. The only problem I had was that the TV didn't worked, but who cares? I came to see the city. For my next vacation I know for sure that I'll be back there.

Reviews.Title: “Blech. Stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: mgottlieb26
Reviews.Content: Maybe I was tainted by the nice hotel that I stayed at in Madrid before I stayed in this hotel for a work conference but I found this hotel pretty gross. The lobby is nice enough and the staff were very nice. They even had a very delicious breakfast that was included in our room price. The hotel is right off the Gran Via metro stop and is centrally located to tourist attractions, restaurants and bars. I didn't even mind the prostitutes waiting around on the street right next to the hotel. They were quiet enough and the area didn't seem sketchy enough to warrant prostitutes in the area. HOWEVER, none of this mattered once I got into my room. Ick. The room smelled like cat litter and sewage. The bathroom also smelled like sewage and the shower had mold. The a/c didn't work. The carpet was old and falling apart. Every time I thought that maybe the smell had gone away, I would walk back into my room after a long day of work and remember how gross it smelled. There are plenty of hotels in the area that are well priced. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satsified”
Reviews.Author: TrvlLuv
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night before heading back to the U.S. It was one of the nicer hotels near the airport. The service was excellent, the rooms were clean (but small - it is Europe). I didn't experience noisiness from outside or adjoining rooms - slept very well. Would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Ehh, go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: HH_Trav
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in a single room. It was a great rate, so I feel like I can't complain. But the room was dingy. The carpet was horribly dirty. I was thrilled to see that my room faced an internal courtyard and not the busy street. But was still kept up all night because some one left their window open and the strong breeze banged it shut with an extremely loud thud every 10 seconds until they came back from their night out on the town. Also, the air conditioning unit in my room broke or stopped working in the middle of the night. The positives are that it is in a great location. I wouldn't be concerned with the street girls around the corner. Really, for what you're paying you can over look that. Especially because you're on Grad Via and these ladies are working in the pedistrian mall around the corner. You don't ever even need to go past them. What do you expect for a 2 star hotel in a big city? I wish the front desk staff would have been a little friendlier but again, what do you expect in a 2 star hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay for a great price”
Reviews.Author: 1662azams
Reviews.Content: We had very low expectations of this hotel going this trip but we were very happy with it. You get a lot for the money. Good room service, good location, clean rooms, clean bathrooms, big rooms. We actually were able to sleep 4 people in this room on the two twin beds. It was a tight squeeze but it was no big deal. Although the room is only meant for 2 people. There are prostitutes on a street near the hotel but it is easily avoidable and not a big deal considering that it is reality. Some travellers freak out when they see that kind of stuff but it is really no big deal cause the prostitues don't do or say anything to you. They aren't even in front of the hotel... They are just on a street near it. The hotel itself is great. The maids were all very friendly and nice and always greeted you. I got better treatment at this hotel than I did at the 4 star hotel I stayed in Seville.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_traveller32
Reviews.Content: hi everyone, ive stayed at this hotel before and ive stayed again, its in a excellent location, a good base to keep going back to, although there isnt much to do in the hotel thisw is reflected in the price, the breakfast is amazing well worth the money. the rooms are dated and old, but its suitable for a few nights stay. it doesnt sound like a brilliant review but like i say ive been a few times so it must be ok, as im very picky. ive been lucky with the rooms ive been given, i have had a single and a double and have always been of good size, i know some of you have been given tiny rooms which is never good. anyway choose this hotel as its so central to everything. have fun. preston.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysAround
Reviews.Content: The Gran Via is in the heart of historical Madrid, within walking distance from almost everything, but the Hotel tryp is definitely NOT recommendable. Ok, it's not their fault if the hotel is located at the corner of Calle de la Montera - an infamous pedestrian area of Madrid, populated by a collection of ugly street hookers; after all, maybe you like the idea (and there's a great restaurant, the Gloria de Montera, within few metres). Also, maybe they cannot get rid of the group of tattooed cracks permanently sitting-in exactly in front of the hotel entrance (I regularly visit Madrid, and personally verified they're always there - month after month after month). But their rooms are unforgivably small, and this IS their responsibility. By "small" I mean than your single room can be so short that beyond your bed you can't even fit a chair; and so narrow that if you open your suitcase flat on the floor, it will fill all the remaining space, and you'll have to stay on your bed. The same architectural style applies to the bathroom as well. Unless you're quite shorty, you'll have to open your legs wide while sitting on the closet, not to bump your knees on the wall in front of you (but if you're particularly tired, you can lean on the wall while pissing). Considering that all this fun comes for not less than 100€ (including a disgusting tortilla stink, which catches you at the lobby and doesn't leave you even at the highest floors), I definitely recommend to choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting..... Absolutely Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Europe6mths
Reviews.Content: To start, this hotel did not have my pre-paid reservation. The rude staff didn't seem to care that I had already paid for my room and barely seemed concerned that they did not have a room for me to stay. Once they finally arranged to put me in a room, the room was next to the old loud elevator and was the size of a closet. The carpet looked like someone had spilled or vomited all over it, I would not walk on the floor without my socks on. The walls were so thin and you could hear everything. I couldn't sleep through the night, as everytime the elevator turned on or guests talked in the hallway... I could hear it. I have been travelling and staying in hotels all over Europe and this has been my worst experience so far. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Almost... just not QUITE.”
Reviews.Author: PlaneJaneConnecticut
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a three day stay at the Hotel Tryp Gran Via. THE LOCATION IS AMAZING. It is located at the heart of Madrid in the middle of the Gran Via. Everything (museums, shopping, food) was right at my fingertips. The rooms were clean (albeit the smell of smoke) and the street noise wasn't too bothersome. Lightsleepers, though, be warned. My roommate didn't fare quite as well as I did. Bathrooms had all the normal, nice things. TV had just enough channels to prevent one from being bored. The Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The lobby was a perfect group meeting area. Internet access in the lobby was two euros for a half hour and for just under four dollars, who could complain? Breakfast was awesome. Spanish favorites (churros) and some classic breakfast items (croissants, fruit, etc.) meant starting the day on the right foot. For those who do not speak Spanish, the question you are asked when you arrive at breakfast is what is your room number. Trust me: it took me a while to get and I do speak Spanish. Overall, nice stay. Remember: location, location, location!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: correfoc
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on this hotel with an air/hotel package, and stayed a week. From TA reviews and our familiarity with Madrid, we felt we knew what to expect, but our expectations were exceeded. Packages with this hotel were much cheaper than with any other central Madrid property. So I concur with many of the other reviews and offer some thoughts of my own. I recommend this hotel if you get a good deal (below 90 eur/night w/brkfst for 2) and it fits your needs/interests. We've previously paid 70 to 80 euros at central Madrid properties without breakfast that are less convenient to transport, etc. Location: the busiest part of the Gran Via, Madrid's showplace avenue from maybe 1920 to 1970. (NYC's Times Sq or LA's Hollywood Blvd are good analogies.) In the last 20-30 years, Gran Via's primacy was lost to newer developments elsewhere in Madrid. Today (a la Times Sq), there's some rebound, producing a mix of 1960's-era storefronts, H&M, Starbucks, Western Union, discount luggage, Zara, McDonald's and lottery ticket stands. Sidewalks are packed with international tourists, "bridge and tunnel" crowds from smaller towns in Spain, recent immigrants, and hurried people who work or live in central Madrid. Super convenient for Metro (Gran Via stop is right in front), shops, food, nightlife and sights, but you're in a crush of diverse humanity. We love that, but some might be overwhelmed. Not a "neighborhood" feel; more like 6th ave in midtown Manhattan. Property: decor is locked in the 70s, but clean. Ex: bathrooms have 70s marble, rooms have wood laminate floors. Water was lukewarm during morning "shower rush." 13 inch TV. Breakfast room was cheery and the morning buffet was awesome. Basically feels like a nice Spanish hotel from the 80s that hasn't made the leap ahead seen in much of the country, but whose staff keeps it clean and efficiently run. Pay for internet on 2 PCs in the lobby or go to cheaper internet/int'l calling spot around the corner. Staff: Friendly and helpful, but rushed during peak check-in/out times. Housekeepers and breakfast staff were efficient and perky. I got the impression much of the staff joined the hotel when the decor was still fresh; it's not the 20-ish, recent-immigrant folks found at many European hotels these days. Other thoughts: Yes, a side street around the corner has prostitutes outside at night. I remember being surprised by that on a previous Madrid trip. Not representative of the area, and easy to avoid. I felt safe, with plenty of police foot patrols of the Gran Via area and pedestrian traffic at all hours, but with the crowds I also stay alert about pickpockets.

Reviews.Title: “Not all that bad..........”
Reviews.Author: AFC1903uschico
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tryp Gran Via for 2 nights at the end of November when we were in Madrid to watch Aberdeen play. We were a bit worried after reading some of the reviews but our stay was 'fine'! Yeah ok so the Gran Via is noisy with traffic - but then what do you expect! We were on the 6th floor and I had no problem sleeping (although in the height of summer if you had to open the window the traffic might be a problem). The main problem with the hotel is that it feels old and dated - the decor is tired and the whole place could do with a lick of paint and 'brightening up'. The corridors to the rooms feel dark and dingy - mainly because they look out over a sort of courtyard and the windows are covered with net curtains that look about 40 years old!!! The room itself was clean enough if a bit on the small side. Our friends had the room next to us though and theirs was huge in comparison! The location is the main good point about the hotel - just a short stroll to many sights and the shops and restaurants. Wouldn't rush back to stay there - but I wouldn't say our experience was anywhere near as bad as some of the reviews!

Reviews.Title: “2 sleepless nights....”
Reviews.Author: Rosie4Me
Reviews.Content: Okay, so the location is good.....and the room was clean, but that's about it. The front desk staff was indifferent, the bellboy was the only one who smiled. The internet was down the 3 days we were there and they didn't seem to care. But, the absolute worst thing was the street noise. 24 hours a day -- horns honking, people yelling and screaming at each other, and the police sirens constantly blasting. If you stay here, do not accept a room facing the street. We were told those were the only ones available at the time of our checkin so we had no choice. Would NOT stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The location is perfect.”
Reviews.Author: onthego96
Reviews.Content: The location was everything. You can walk to the Prado,Reina Sofia and the plaza Mayor. The staff were helpful and courteous. The room we had was small but clean and the breakfast buffet was excellent. All things considered this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Is the location enough to overlook everything else?”
Reviews.Author: Elchie
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a three night stay (Monday-Thursday.) As evidenced by the reviews below, the hotel's most redeeming quality by far is the location: right on the Gran Via with easy access to the metro, good bus lines, and Madrid's sights. The location, however, does come with some less than redeeming qualities like prostitutes and other less than welcoming-looking characters hanging around day and night. The hotel does have a security guard posted outside almost all the time (this probably says more about the area than the hotel's service level.) I did not feel unsafe in the area, but there was just a general seedy overtone. The room itself was small and dated: a twin bed with carpet that had clearly seen better days. The bathroom, however, looks like it was renovated recently. The air conditioning problem was frustrating: in the heat of the summer the small room became stifling in the early morning hours. The breakfast buffet was better than expected compared to the rest of the hotel: a wide selection of juices, meats, cheeses, danishes, cereals, and hot items like eggs and bacon. I got a great deal on solmelia.com for my stay. I would only consider returning if I got a similar or better deal. There are several other hotels in the same area, so I would first try to find something with the same location convenience but better accommodations. .

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel...decent location for 1st time visit.”
Reviews.Author: jesmahal
Reviews.Content: I chose this location since it was very central, which it was, but it was also at the corner of what seemed to be the hottest spot for hookers to solicit business. I was taking my 18 year old college bound son for his first visit of a European city, and this was his first observation. Even at 9:00 am they were already out on the Gran Via as we looked out from the breakfast room. The twin room we had was small, about 12' x 16' and the huge marble bathroom was practically the same size as the bedroom. The windows were French style, and the ones on room 206 would not close properly and rattle each time we closed the bathroom door. I read reviews about the air conditioning being shut off in the middle of the night and this is the truth; at about 4:00 am nightly the air was turned off and not turned on again till 9:00 am. We were in Madrid for three days of 102 degree weather, so we woke up early each morning from the lack of cool air. Do not stay here in the height of summer if you are used to air conditioning. Buffet breakfast was good with lots of selections, and there is a water/beverage machine on the restaurant level. A newly added feature were two PCs in the lobby right next to the front desk for guest use, and an hour of internet time was only 3 euros. I probably would try a different hotel on a second visit, but all in all it is not a bad hotel for the rate they charge.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but I'd see if better available”
Reviews.Author: SafferMark
Reviews.Content: The review by Mark Hustwit says it all. The hotel is tired, and the staff (same people, I might add) vary from disinterested to helpful. The location is excellent, and particularly good for gay night life and shopping. Advanced request for a quiet double room was only partially met. The room was quiet, down a little dead-end side corridor, but the bed/s were 2 singles (I was told they only have a very limited number of double rooms throughout the whole hotel). Popular with high school tour groups, which can make breakfast in the restaurant a trying affair.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: David K
Reviews.Content: Some old hotels are quaint, and some old hotels have lots of character. The Tryp Gran Vía just is old. The property´s redeeming quality is the location, right in the city center. I spent two nights here as part of a seminar group. Left to myself, I would have booked another hotel. My single room was quite small and dark, with no place to open a suitcase other than the bed. The closet was adequate to hang a few shirts and trousers, but not large enough to store a suitcase out of the way. There was no luggage stand. As a result, I had to move my bags around the room as I dressed or got ready for bed. The small twin bed was relatively comfortable. The bathroom was an oddly-configured, long space. The vanity area and the bath/shower were sufficient, but the commode´s placement in a narrow part of the room made for inconvenient, if not uncomfortable, use. The bathroom fixtures and tile were quite dated and worn. Nonetheless, the bathroom was generally clean, as was the rest of the room. My room looked into an interior patio, which did eliminate street noise from the bustling Gran Vía. However, opening windows to the patio did not create sufficient air flow to ventilate the room properly. The room was constantly stuffy, a problem compounded by the fact that the building´s air conditioning was turned on only from 7.00 pm to 3.00 am. Temperatures in Madrid were unseasonably cool during my stay, but the room was uncomfortably warm even when the air conditioning operated. The hotel staff seemed overworked, and staffing levels were insufficient to meet the needs of guests checking in and seeking information. No one was overtly unpleasant or unhelpful; staff members just seemed fairly resigned to the limitations of their work place. This hotel is much below other properties in the Tryp hotel chain. In contrast, the Tryp Washington, only a few blocks down Gran Vía, is a much brighter and modern hotel that costs about the same.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Hotel served the purpose!”
Reviews.Author: MarkHustwit
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel with 15 male friends on a stag (batchelor) party! The location is excellent, right next to an underground stop and near open bus tour, shops and restaurants. The hotel's communal areas are clean and modern however the rooms are small and not particularly special. They are however cleaned every morning and have a safe (1 euro charge each time used) mini bar, T.V etc. The view from our room was appauling. Breakfast is reasonable with hot and cold options in buffet style. Overall, the hotel is ideal for people who want somewhere relatively comfortable to sleep etc without the WOW factor.

Reviews.Title: “Good location BUT smelly and stuffy”
Reviews.Author: MathildeWaltzing
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located, with the nearest underground access just a few seconds away. Puerta del Sol via El Corte Ingles Preciados is a mere 5 minutes' walk, and all the attractions such as the Cibelese and Plaza de Oriente within a few minutes' walk. Some items from the mini-bar had been removed prior to my arrival, and for fear of being charged for things I did not consume (and because of the previous reviews on this website) I marched down to reception and in Spanish, complained and asserted that I would not be made to pay for things I did not use. I guess that set the tone for the rest of my stay, as the staff appeared to show a level of respect for the lone female traveller from Down Under. I found the weekend doorman rude, and he did not seem to do anything but glare at people and walk in and out of the lobby. He did not even open the door for me or help me with the lifts, even when he saw me struggling with my suitcase. The other doorman was helpful though, and friendly. I did not have any difficulties at all with the staff at reception --- I guess that if you make an effort to speak their language, they make an effort to be helpful as well. In terms of the SMELL, it is bloody awful. It was probably chlorine, but it was so strong it would stick to your skin and hair. It did not help that tha room was so tiny and the airconditioning always on HOT, even when you put it on cool. Faulty? To me it was a good thing that they turn them off at night as it would suffocate you. The combination of the smell and the heat was not good or healthy at all, and the only time you can actually breathe and enjoy sleeping is when you're not in your room! Also, it did not help that a group of loud English speaking people were staying next door to me. Single female travellers, beware. If you turn right towards the McDonalds corner of the hotel, I just found out yesterday that it is a meeting place for ladies of the night. Stay out if you don't want to be mistaken as one. I guess the hotel has read the reviews here and is actually making changes in terms of security --- the hotel gives a list of do's and dont's regarding people's belongings, and the front entrance is locked from midnight. Just ring the bell outside and you'd be let in immediately. Forget the hotel cafe -- it is now permanently closed in the evenings. So much for the Hemingway experience! The TV is also hard to operate, and those with children should be extra vigilant with the remote controls. ALL programmes are uncensored. The cheapest taxis would be the ones waiting out in the streets. The ones they call for you are aware of your tourist status, so charge you more than necessary. Forget the business centre. Unless you are actually holding a conference at the hotel, the only business centre available to you is one of the two PCs at the lobby with internet access --- and yes, you guessed it --- not free! It costs 3 Euros for an hour, and 2 Euros for 30 minutes. International calling cards also do not work at the hotel --- ask the tired but patient phone operator. The 43 code they give you is only for making collect calls. There are telefonicas on the Gran Via, so that should do the trick if you want to save money. All in all, good value for location and staff are making an effort to assist. Just show them who's boss -- in their own language.

Reviews.Title: “Pictures worth a thousand words”
Reviews.Author: NG_Travel
Reviews.Content: First of all,when you arrive at the desk don't bother to ask for anything because you won't get it anyway, the staff don't care about your request. Secondly all the rooms smell awfully bad it smells like a sewer.The carpet the blankets and the wall are stained with i don't want to know what! Finally the bathroom is by far the worst i've ever seen in years,it has mouldiness everywhere from the walls on the floor and to the ceiling.Just take a look at the picture you will see for yourself. The location is great but bring earplugs it is VERY noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, sleepless nights”
Reviews.Author: RCox
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was booked by a company we work for, so I had no choice, but I'd read the reviews and was hoping they weren't true. Unfortunately they are. First, the good points because there are some great reasons to consider this hotel. The beds are great - good mattresses and clean, starched cotton sheets. The rooms are cleaned well and the bath towels are thick and big. In the remodelled rooms, the curtains are lovely and rich, with black out lining. There are two elevators, the quaint old fashioned sort that only hold 2 people with luggage, but at least you don't need to lug stuff up stairs! Breakfast is fab, with a buffet of cheeses, fresh fruit, meats, yogurt, eggs, bacon, sausage, salads, toast, pastries, juice, coffee, several teas and hot chocolate. The location is ok - only 10 minutes walk to Plaza Mayor and the museums, plenty of restaurants just out the door (a great veggie retaurant - in Madrid! - down the side street beside the hotel) and a shop around the corner that sells bottled water, fruit, etc. Now the bad points. Everything feels tired and in need of repairs. There were cigarett burns in the carpet, furniture and blankets. The skirting and drawers were broken or chipped, and the carpet was horribly stained. There is only one english channel, CNN and no kettle. The safe deposit box costs a euro every time you open it, and don't even THINK of asking reception for change, as their stock answer to any request is a short, rude "no". They never cracked a smile the whole time we were there and seemed to hate their jobs. You have a choice of 2 rooms. One type overlooks a central, concreted courtyard. These rooms are quieter, but tiny and claustrophobic. We had an outside room. These are roomier and sunny, but overlook an incredibly noisy road. We were on the 7th floor, but even with the double glazed windows shut we heard horns, wistles, musicians and revellers ... all night. Would I stay again? No. We saw other hotels on QUIETER side streets that looked lovely and were around the same price. I'd shop around.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Svetlana P
Reviews.Content: I liked staying in this hotel, although the quite small room was facing inner yard roof. I read in other posters that AC was not working at night, but in our room it was cooling so much, that I took a blanket from cupboard at night. The breakfast was very good and tasty with great variety. The hotel is only couple of steps from Gran Via metro station, centrally located. Tourist attractions are within walking distance. Reception staff marked on the map places to see, so we managed during one evening to see most of beautiful Madrid. I would give it 4 star rank for service and location.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Right in the city centre, with this hotel you get what you pay for. Yes, in summer, it is hot. So is every hotel in Madrid (I travel to this city every year, at least twice in anything from 2 to 5*). Yes, Gran Via street is noisy (it is the nightlife that makes Spain famous!) but the hotel is very convenient for sightseeing, the rooms are clean and comfortable and the breakfasts are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Ditto! Stay some place else.”
Reviews.Author: debphoto
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review for this hotel and now I don't see it listed. I feel so strongly about how poor this hotel is that I'm writing another one. Wow, this hotel is the worst place I've ever stayed in. Don't convince yourself that these things "won't happen to you." Yes, they will turn off the air conditioner at night. Yes, they think that's within their rights. No, you can't open up the windows because you're on the equivalence to 42nd Street in New York. Yes, the carpets are stained. Yes, the walls are too. Yes, the paint is peeling. Yes, the curtains are ripped. We had to jerry-rig a bunch of safety pins through the curtain to keep it held together and thus the neon lights from shining in. The pins, no doubt, are still there. Yes, the staff is rude and unaccommodating. Yes, they are doing construction on the hotel and therefore, no you will not get to take your siesta. We tried to sleep through 2 hours of hammering, sawing and drilling right next to our room to no avail. We were traveling with a large group (of 60 people) so switching rooms was not an option. Do yourself a favor and stay some place else!

Reviews.Title: “Grubby, stifling, unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: Swindoneric
Reviews.Content: Probably the worst hotel in which I have stayed. The room was filthy and smelled! The airconditioning had one temperature - which seemed to be around a hundred degrees. The hotel was full so I couldn't change rooms and the restaurant wasn't open. The carpets in the room were stained with heaven knows what and some of the bedding was ripped. All for the bargain price of 164 Euros. Never, ever again

Reviews.Title: “Love Madrid”
Reviews.Author: elyrivera
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a trip to Spail (Madrid and Barcelona). In Madrid, I stayed at the Tryp Gran Via Hotel. My experience was excellent. The location of this Hotel is in the Upper site of Gran Vìa Avenue, very near Alcalà St. and Plaza La Cibeles. You can walk to Museo del Prado and to Puerta del Sol. Besides de Hotel you can find shops and cafeterias. The room was very clean, and we ask for a non-smoking and in a quiet site of the hotel, and the room fills our requirements. The personnel very courteous. The price is very reasonable, for a three star hotel, but you can find special promotions in different sites in Internet. I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected, I would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reviewing all the posts, I was a bit leary of staying in this hotel, but much to my surprise, I enjoyed it there. The location is fantastic, walking distance to many nice shops, and tourist attractions. The cost may seem a little high, and the rooms have some wear and tear, but overall I would stay there again. The rooms were cleaned daily and the hotel staff were all friendly. The bathrooms were very clean and large in size. Could use a carpet shampoo and fresh paint. Restaurants and department stores are conveniently located nearby and there was always a doorman there to greet us on return, except in the late hours when you ring the bell. There are prostitutes on the streets, but not at the hotel, they are around the corner and are easily identifiable and thus easy to avoid. All you have to do is walk the other direction where all the huge shops are located. The beds are small but I am 6'3" and did not have a problem sleeping. Gran Via is a major thoroughfare, so there is alot of traffic. The noise is not as bad as I expected, it was hardly noticeable unless the window was open. The first picture is the street in front of the Hotel. If you look closely you can see the Hotel Gran Via sign on the right - it is a long vertical sign and is easily noticed when walking up and down the street. At night the sign is well lit and you can see it walking from any direction.

Reviews.Title: “Stifling hot, airconditioned turned off at night in August”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I awoke stifling in the middle of the night covered with sweat, I called the front desk and the man on duty said the airconditioning was turned off for a certain number of hours on manager's orders. The next morning the manager confirmed it was his policy to turn off air conditioning for a certain number of hours. He didn't understand that it is not ethical to advertise a room as airconditioned, charge accordingly, and then not provide airconditioning. I speak Spanish fluently, so this was not a matter of lack of communication. In addition, the carpet was dirty and the second lock on the door didn't work. Strongly advise travelers to stay away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ecardenas
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel and it has an excellent location. It is very clean and you get what you need. It has a security box for 1 euro. It is true that it can be noisy but if you take ear stoppers that problem goes away. Madrid is a great city and everyone goes out really late so there is a lot of activity until 3 or 4 in the morning. The breakfast at the hotel is good. I recommend you have dinner at Larios Cafe (cuban restaurant) it is excellent and it is not too expensive. They have a live band and it is very nice. After dinner you can go downstairs here the DJ is to dance the night away. Another excellent Restaurant for Paella is Restaurante los Galagos. For Tapas there is a great little place called Taberna El Tablao not a touristic place, more local). Other nice and inexpensive places to eat: Madrid Uno and there is a Place called "VIPS" and it has good and inexpensive food. It is the type of restaurant like Pizzeria Uno here in the US. They have salads, hamburguers, sandwiches, etc....a little bit of everything While we were in Madrid we visted The Palacio Real (very impressive). The guided tour is 9 euros per person. Other places to see: Puerta de Alcala, Cibeles, Puerta del Sol, parque del Campo del Moro, Teatro Real. Side trips: Toledo is a nice place to go to. We took a tour for half a day, I reccomend the all day tour. The half a day tour is 40 euros per person but I think that the tour is too fast. You do not have enough time to enjoy the scenery. Another nice city to go to is Alcala de Henares. (you can go via train, it costs 4.25 euros). This is the where Miguel Cervantes lived. It is nice place to go walk around. I loved Madrid!

HotelInfo.Name: TRYP Gran Via
HotelInfo.Address: Gran Via 25, 28012 Madrid, Spain
